body:
I was surprised that the 2d equivalent to `w_points` was assigned to `base_grid[:, :, :, 0]` instead of `base_grid[...,1]`.

I think that this is explained by the first Note at https://pytorch.org/docs/master/nn.html#torch.nn.functional.grid_sample :

> To avoid confusion in notation, let’s note that x corresponds to the width dimension IW, y corresponds to the height dimension IH and z corresponds to the depth dimension ID.

But I'd like someone else to confirm that this is correct.
